title: Amulet of strangulation
data:
**[English]()**

 • [한국어](/wiki/Amulet_of_strangulation/ko "Amulet of strangulation/ko")

 • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Amulet_of_strangulation/zh-CN "Amulet of strangulation/zh-CN")

| " [![Circular amulet.png](/images/8/8b/Circular_amulet.png)](/wiki/File:Circular_amulet.png) |                                                               |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                                         | amulet of strangulation                                       |
| Appearance                                                                                   | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance") |
| Base price                                                                                   | 150 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                             |
| Weight                                                                                       | [20](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                                   |

An **amulet of strangulation** is a type of [amulet](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)
  - [5.1 Turns to live](#Turns_to_live)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [6.3 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

13.5% of randomly-generated amulets will be an amulet of strangulation. The amulet is generated cursed 90.5% of the time, uncursed 9% of the time, and blessed 0.5% of the time.

An amulet of strangulation is always generated in a chest on the middle floor of [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower "Vlad's Tower") outside of [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") files.

## Description

When worn, the amulet immediately begins constricting the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero")'s throat, beginning a [delayed instadeath](/wiki/Delayed_instadeath "Delayed instadeath") and [auto-identifying](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") the amulet: Unless the hero is in the form of a monster that either lacks a [head](/wiki/Head "Head") or is both [breathless](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless") and normally [mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless"), they will be killed by [strangulation](/wiki/Strangulation "Strangulation") in six turns.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) While being strangled, [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength") is abused each turn, and they hero cannot perform several actions: they are unable to [quaff](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff"), operate [whistles](/wiki/Whistle "Whistle") or other similar [instruments](/wiki/Instrument "Instrument"), [read](/wiki/Read "Read") [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") if they are currently [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind"), or cast [spells](/wiki/Spells "Spells").[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

Removing the amulet aborts strangulation. In [wizard mode](/wiki/Wizard_mode "Wizard mode"), choosing not to die when killed by the amulet will cause it to vanish.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) The timer for strangulation is paused during the three turns of [invulnerability](/wiki/Invulnerability "Invulnerability") granted by successful prayer.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

[Eating the amulet](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry") has a 19⁄20 chance of choking you to death immediately unless you are breathless. [Rust monsters](/wiki/Rust_monster "Rust monster") will avoid eating an amulet of strangulation.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

## Strategy

The amulet of strangulation is a dangerous item and one of the main reasons, if not *the* main reason, that a player should avoid putting on unidentified amulets, especially without at least determining their [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude"). While removing the amulet is enough to save you, most amulets of strangulation are generated cursed.

Praying while wearing an amulet of strangulation is considered a major [trouble](/wiki/Trouble "Trouble"), and successfully praying will destroy the amulet and abort strangulation. Most methods of [curse removal](/wiki/Curse_removal "Curse removal") that do not rely on spells (e.g. [remove curse](/wiki/Spellbook_of_remove_curse "Spellbook of remove curse")) or reading scrolls blind can also uncurse the amulet and allow you to remove it. A [wand of cancellation](/wiki/Wand_of_cancellation "Wand of cancellation") is close to a last resort in this regard - if you have turns to spare and no other means of uncursing the amulet, you can drop everything else that you do not want cancelled, then zap yourself with the wand and safely remove it.

## History

The amulet of strangulation first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"). From this version to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"), including some variants based on those versions, the amulet can strangle you regardless of your current form, though having breathlessness will save you from choking while eating the amulet.

The inability to cast spells while wearing an amulet of strangulation is introduced in [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1").

## Messages

- You are being strangled.

  You are being strangled by wearing an amulet of strangulation, as viewed via [enlightenment](/wiki/Enlightenment "Enlightenment").

### Turns to live

The messages below correspond to the amount of turns you have left to live in the *Alt. message* column occur when you are [breathless](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless"), and 1⁄50 of the time otherwise.[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)

| Message                        | Alt. message                                        | Turns left to live |
| ------------------------------ | --------------------------------------------------- | ------------------ |
| "It constricts your throat!"   | "It constricts your throat!"                        | 5                  |
| "You find it hard to breathe." | "Your neck is becoming constricted."                | 4                  |
| "You're gasping for air."      | "Your blood is having trouble reaching your brain." | 3                  |
| "You can no longer breathe."   | "The pressure on your neck increases."              | 2                  |
| "You're turning blue."         | "Your consciousness is fading."                     | 1                  |
| "You suffocate."               | "You suffocate."                                    | 0                  |

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), a cursed amulet of strangulation [named](/wiki/Name "Name") life saving is generated in The Chamber of Junk within the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest") at level creation.

Gaining invulnerability from a [potion of invulnerability](/wiki/Potion_of_invulnerability "Potion of invulnerability") does not prevent a delayed instadeath from a worn or eaten amulet of strangulation.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [incantifiers](/wiki/Incantifier "Incantifier") can "eat" an amulet of strangulation without consequence, since they are incorporeal and absorbing the magic from the amulet rather than physically consuming it. Eating the amulet in any other form will not instantly kill the hero, but instead causes temporary strangulation for six turns - due to dNetHack's breath timer mechanic, this means that they will die if their current timer is six turns or lower, unless the property is removed. Successfully praying can cure strangulation from choking this way, while obtaining the breathless property (e.g. via an unbreathing polyform) ignores strangulation and allows it to time out harmlessly.

The [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") has a unique [monster spell](/wiki/DNetHack_monster_spells "DNetHack monster spells") that forces an amulet of strangulation onto the hero's neck, transforming any currently worn amulet into one if possible. If the hero is wearing an amulet, the spell can be prevented completely with [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance").

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, an amulet of strangulation is generated at one of six particular squares on the locate level of the [Geek quest](/wiki/Geek_quest "Geek quest").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 362](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mondata.c#L362): *`can_be_strangled` function*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/do\_wear.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 777](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/do_wear.c#L777)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 336](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mondata.c#L336): *`can_blow` function*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 350](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mondata.c#L350): *`can_chant` function*
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 493](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/potion.c#L493)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/timeout.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 697](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/timeout.c#L697)
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [src/timeout.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 506](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/timeout.c#L506)
8. [↑](#cite_ref-8) [src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 886](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mon.c#L886)
9. [↑](#cite_ref-9) [src/timeout.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 257](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/timeout.c#L257)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Amulet of strangulation

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 한국어

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
"
Name amulet of strangulation
Appearance random
Base price 150 zm
Weight 20

An amulet of strangulation is a type of amulet that appears in NetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 Messages
    • 5.1 Turns to live
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 SLASH'EM
    • 6.2 dNetHack
    • 6.3 SlashTHEM
  • 7 References

Generation

13.5% of randomly-generated amulets will be an amulet of strangulation. The amulet is generated cursed 90.5% of the time, uncursed 9% of the time, and blessed 0.5% of the time.

An amulet of strangulation is always generated in a chest on the middle floor of Vlad's Tower outside of bones files.

Description

When worn, the amulet immediately begins constricting the hero's throat, beginning a delayed instadeath and auto-identifying the amulet: Unless the hero is in the form of a monster that either lacks a head or is both breathless and normally mindless, they will be killed by strangulation in six turns.[1][2] While being strangled, strength is abused each turn, and they hero cannot perform several actions: they are unable to quaff, operate whistles or other similar instruments, read scrolls if they are currently blind, or cast spells.[3][4][5]

Removing the amulet aborts strangulation. In wizard mode, choosing not to die when killed by the amulet will cause it to vanish.[6] The timer for strangulation is paused during the three turns of invulnerability granted by successful prayer.[7]

Eating the amulet has a 19⁄20 chance of choking you to death immediately unless you are breathless. Rust monsters will avoid eating an amulet of strangulation.[8]

Strategy

The amulet of strangulation is a dangerous item and one of the main reasons, if not the main reason, that a player should avoid putting on unidentified amulets, especially without at least determining their beatitude. While removing the amulet is enough to save you, most amulets of strangulation are generated cursed.

Praying while wearing an amulet of strangulation is considered a major trouble, and successfully praying will destroy the amulet and abort strangulation. Most methods of curse removal that do not rely on spells (e.g. remove curse) or reading scrolls blind can also uncurse the amulet and allow you to remove it. A wand of cancellation is close to a last resort in this regard - if you have turns to spare and no other means of uncursing the amulet, you can drop everything else that you do not want cancelled, then zap yourself with the wand and safely remove it.

History

The amulet of strangulation first appears in NetHack 3.0.0. From this version to NetHack 3.4.3, including some variants based on those versions, the amulet can strangle you regardless of your current form, though having breathlessness will save you from choking while eating the amulet.

The inability to cast spells while wearing an amulet of strangulation is introduced in NetHack 3.6.1.

Messages

You are being strangled.
You are being strangled by wearing an amulet of strangulation, as viewed via enlightenment.

Turns to live

The messages below correspond to the amount of turns you have left to live in the Alt. message column occur when you are breathless, and 1⁄50 of the time otherwise.[9]

Message Alt. message Turns left to live
"It constricts your throat!" "It constricts your throat!" 5
"You find it hard to breathe." "Your neck is becoming constricted." 4
"You're gasping for air." "Your blood is having trouble reaching your brain." 3
"You can no longer breathe." "The pressure on your neck increases." 2
"You're turning blue." "Your consciousness is fading." 1
"You suffocate." "You suffocate." 0

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, a cursed amulet of strangulation named life saving is generated in The Chamber of Junk within the Lawful Quest at level creation.

Gaining invulnerability from a potion of invulnerability does not prevent a delayed instadeath from a worn or eaten amulet of strangulation.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, incantifiers can "eat" an amulet of strangulation without consequence, since they are incorporeal and absorbing the magic from the amulet rather than physically consuming it. Eating the amulet in any other form will not instantly kill the hero, but instead causes temporary strangulation for six turns - due to dNetHack's breath timer mechanic, this means that they will die if their current timer is six turns or lower, unless the property is removed. Successfully praying can cure strangulation from choking this way, while obtaining the breathless property (e.g. via an unbreathing polyform) ignores strangulation and allows it to time out harmlessly.

The Wizard of Yendor has a unique monster spell that forces an amulet of strangulation onto the hero's neck, transforming any currently worn amulet into one if possible. If the hero is wearing an amulet, the spell can be prevented completely with magic resistance.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, in addition to SLASH'EM details, an amulet of strangulation is generated at one of six particular squares on the locate level of the Geek quest.

References

  1. ↑ src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 362: can_be_strangled function
  2. ↑ src/do_wear.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 777
  3. ↑ src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 336: can_blow function
  4. ↑ src/mondata.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 350: can_chant function
  5. ↑ src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 493
  6. ↑ src/timeout.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 697
  7. ↑ src/timeout.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 506
  8. ↑ src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 886
  9. ↑ src/timeout.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 257

The amulet is generated cursed 90.5% of the time, uncursed 9% of the time, and blessed 0.5% of the time. An amulet of strangulation is always generated in a chest on the middle floor of [[Vlad's Tower]] outside of [[bones]] files. ==Description== When worn, the amulet immediately begins constricting the [[hero]]'s throat, beginning a [[delayed instadeath]] and [[auto-identify]]ing the amulet: Unless the hero is in the form of a monster that either lacks a [[head]] or is both [[breathless]] and normally [[mindless]], they will be killed by [[strangulation]] in six turns.{{refsrc|src/mondata.c|362|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=can_be_strangled function}}{{refsrc|src/do_wear.c|777|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} While being strangled, [[strength]] is abused each turn, and they hero cannot perform several actions: they are unable to [[quaff]], operate [[whistle]]s or other similar [[instrument]]s, [[read]] [[scroll]]s if they are currently [[blind]], or cast [[spells]].{{refsrc|src/mondata.c|336|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=can_blow function}}{{refsrc|src/mondata.c|350|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=can_chant function}}{{refsrc|src/potion.c|493|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} Removing the amulet aborts strangulation. In [[wizard mode]], choosing not to die when killed by the amulet will cause it to vanish.{{refsrc|src/timeout.c|697|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} The timer for strangulation is paused during the three turns of [[invulnerability]] granted by successful prayer.{{refsrc|src/timeout.c|506|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} [[Eating jewelry|Eating the amulet]] has a {{frac|19|20}} chance of choking you to death immediately unless you are breathless. [[Rust monster]]s will avoid eating an amulet of strangulation.{{refsrc|src/mon.c|886|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} ==Strategy== The amulet of strangulation is a dangerous item and one of the main reasons, if not ''the'' main reason, that a player should avoid putting on unidentified amulets, especially without at least determining their [[beatitude]]. While removing the amulet is enough to save you, most amulets of strangulation are generated cursed. Praying while wearing an amulet of strangulation is considered a major [[trouble]], and successfully praying will destroy the amulet and abort strangulation. Most methods of [[curse removal]] that do not rely on spells (e.g. {{spell of|remove curse}}) or reading scrolls blind can also uncurse the amulet and allow you to remove it. A [[wand of cancellation]] is close to a last resort in this regard - if you have turns to spare and no other means of uncursing the amulet, you can drop everything else that you do not want cancelled, then zap yourself with the wand and safely remove it. ==History== The amulet of strangulation first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]]. From this version to [[NetHack 3.4.3]], including some variants based on those versions, the amulet can strangle you regardless of your current form, though having breathlessness will save you from choking while eating the amulet. The inability to cast spells while wearing an amulet of strangulation is introduced in [[NetHack 3.6.1]]. ==Messages== {{message|You are being strangled.|You are being strangled by wearing an amulet of strangulation, as viewed via [[enlightenment]].}} ===Turns to live=== The messages below correspond to the amount of turns you have left to live in the ''Alt. message'' column occur when you are [[breathless]], and {{frac|50}} of the time otherwise.{{refsrc|src/timeout.c|257|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} {|class="wikitable" !Message!!Alt. message!!Turns left to live |- |"It constricts your throat!" |"It constricts your throat!" |5 |- |"You find it hard to breathe." |"Your neck is becoming constricted." |4 |- |"You're gasping for air." |"Your blood is having trouble reaching your brain." |3 |- |"You can no longer breathe." |"The pressure on your neck increases." |2 |- |"You're turning blue." |"Your consciousness is fading." |1 |- |"You suffocate." |"You suffocate." |0 |} ==Variants== ===SLASH'EM=== In [[SLASH'EM]], a cursed amulet of strangulation [[name]]d life saving is generated in The Chamber of Junk within the [[Lawful Quest]] at level creation. Gaining invulnerability from a [[potion of invulnerability]] does not prevent a delayed instadeath from a worn or eaten amulet of strangulation. ===dNetHack=== In [[dNetHack]], [[incantifier]]s can "eat" an amulet of strangulation without consequence, since they are incorporeal and absorbing the magic from the amulet rather than physically consuming it. Eating the amulet in any other form will not instantly kill the hero, but instead causes temporary strangulation for six turns - due to dNetHack's breath timer mechanic, this means that they will die if their current timer is six turns or lower, unless the property is removed. Successfully praying can cure strangulation from choking this way, while obtaining the breathless property (e.g. via an unbreathing polyform) ignores strangulation and allows it to time out harmlessly. The [[Wizard of Yendor]] has a unique [[dNetHack monster spells|monster spell]] that forces an amulet of strangulation onto the hero's neck, transforming any currently worn amulet into one if possible. If the hero is wearing an amulet, the spell can be prevented completely with [[magic resistance]]. ===SlashTHEM=== In [[SlashTHEM]], in addition to SLASH'EM details, an amulet of strangulation is generated at one of six particular squares on the locate level of the [[Geek quest]]. ==References== {{nethack-367}} [[Category:Amulets|Strangulation]]
